subject: Procedure for seeking invocation of the Bank Guarantee(s)
text: HRdf4 <efmv =TTHF gfaarut Phona 91-11-25074100/2574200 Fax 91-11-25093507/250935+4 (Tr+ AAtT &r TT7TT HTTNTa) Extn 2223/2318/2468/2553 77 # National Highways Authority of India (Ministry 0f Road Transport & Highways) 3-5 & 6, Sactor-10 Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 No. 11041/217/2007-Admn: June 2007 PQLICY MATTERS-AQMNISTRATIONIFINANCE 1212002) (Decision taken on Finance Division's File No: 16001/1/2007 DGM(F VI) Sub: Procedure for seeking invocation ot the Bank Guarnteelg) Further to the Policy Circular (79/2004) of even number dated 15th March 2004 under which the procedure for seeking extension or invocation of Bank Guarantees (BGs) was prescribed, the following additional points should be complied with while invoking the BGs: 1 After  obtaining approval of the  competent  autharity for invoking the Bank Guarantees, it may be ensured that (i) the claimlinvocation should be made by inviting specific reference to Ihe default in the performance guaranteed under the bank guarantee; & (ii) the claimlinvocation is made by or on behalf of the beneficiary named in the bank guarantee (i.e. if the guarantee Is Issued favouring Chairman, NHAI; the invocation may aiso be made by or on behalf of the Chairman) along with all the original BGs and subsequent amendmentslextensions. copy of claimlinvocation letter may also be given to the Controlling Office of Branch (Bank) IL Acknowledgement showing full signature name and designation of receiving official in respect of the receipt of invocation letter on behalf of the bank may be kept on record. The acknowledgement must be dated and time of receipt should also be recorded, III. Regular follow up may be made with the branch and its controlling office to immediately obtain the proceeds and ensure that a demand draft or pay order is collected from the concerned branch: Effort should be made to collect the proceeds on the same working or  latest in the morning hours of next working day.
